channel.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops
channel.description:
Kinda surprised no one made a thread about this yet.
Very good solo campaign. Plot kinda deviates from the CoD norm, since it's more character based and not about all-out war. Also, you can blow up the enemies' limbs Soldier of Fortune style.
Still haven't beat it, but so far it seems lengthier and a bit more varied gameplay wise than MW2.
As for multiplayer, it's basically MW2 with dedicated servers and slightly more balanced killstreak bonuses and no tactical nuke (as far as I know, the largest killstreak is 11 kills). However the game needs a patch to fix the lag spikes players are getting during the matches and there also seems to be numerous reports of bad graphical performance on MP only.
The server browser is decent enough, at least it's far better than BC2's one, and there's an option to change the field of view in the settings, which is great for me, since I can't stand the default field of view from MW2.
Anyone else willing to share their opinion on the game?

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops
item.dc:creator: brokenfridgehinge
item.description:
Even bots have bad taste in games. But yeah anyway, last CoD game I played was MW1 which was actually decent. But after BF3 comes out I’ll probably be like Call of What? Ohhhh, you mean that game that nobody plays anymore… except 12 year olds. Yeah BF3 is going to own.

I think there were enough changes in the mp to warrant a sequel. The change in killstreaks had a massive effect.

Pfffft

Have you played a game like Team Fortress 2? Don’t need TF3 for that game to add content 5 times as much as a COD sequel.

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
CTID:

Even then, the MP didn’t change too much. It had different killstreaks, more weapons, etc. But it still came down to the same game modes and everything. You still run around trying to kill other players in exactly the same fashion as in CoD 4. There were no major changes to the formula of the game, and that’s what will make a game series stagnate, yet Activision knows that people will continue to buy the games regardless because people don’t seem to care.

I think there were enough changes in the mp to warrant a sequel. The change in killstreaks had a massive effect.

Read full topic

Even then, the MP didn’t change too much. It had different killstreaks, more weapons, etc. But it still came down to the same game modes and everything. item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
CTID:

Except it’s not. I’ve played all 4 CoD’s on PC that have come out since 2007.

Modern Warfare: Run, point, shoot, reload, repeat
Modern Warfare 2: Run, point, shoot, reload, repeat, have character die 18 times in cutscenes

The only real change to gameplay is it adds “vehicles” that control like shit, and you’re on both for a total of about 5 minutes throughout the entire game anyway.

Oh okay. You’re right. The campaigns are the same. I was talking about the mp, which I think is more important as it is the main if not only reason most people buy CoD.

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
garthbartin:

Wrong. MW2’s gameplay is very very different than MW. Or at least on the pc it is. It’s so easy to tell I’ll leave it to you to forget how it’s different. If you still can’t get it I’ll explain.

Except it’s not. I’ve played all 4 CoD’s on PC that have come out since 2007.

Modern Warfare: Run, point, shoot, reload, repeat
Modern Warfare 2: Run, point, shoot, reload, repeat, have character die 18 times in cutscenes

The only real change to gameplay is it adds “vehicles” that control like shit, and you’re on both for a total of about 5 minutes throughout the entire game anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
CTID:

The same could be said about CoD 4 and MW2. Modern Warfare 2 added new weapons. Nothing new was added to the gameplay at all. Therefore, by your logic, it should be DLC, not a sequel.

Wrong. MW2’s gameplay is very very different than MW. Or at least on the pc it is. It’s so easy to tell I’ll leave it to you to forget how it’s different. If you still can’t get it I’ll explain.

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
garthbartin:

You know, why wasn’t Black Ops just a DLC for MW2? Would have made a lot more sense. They appear to be using the same engine. Other than changing the set of weapons and killstreaks, the gameplay has hardly been changed. The campaign, though an entirely different storyline, doesn’t really bring anything new to the table. Aren’t sequels reserved for, I don’t know, things that actually evolve the series? Black Ops is hardly more different than MW2 as BFBC2 is to the Vietnam Expansion.

The same could be said about CoD 4 and MW2. Modern Warfare 2 added new weapons. Nothing new was added to the gameplay at all. Therefore, by your logic, it should be DLC, not a sequel.

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops
item.dc:creator: ac3d
item.description:
garthbartin:

You know, why wasn’t Black Ops just a DLC for MW2? Would have made a lot more sense. They appear to be using the same engine.

It uses a modified version of the WAW engine which is a modified version of the MW1 engine, and compared to MW2, it’s pretty ugly.

garthbartin:

Aren’t sequels reserved for, I don’t know, things that actually evolve the series? Black Ops is hardly more different than MW2 as BFBC2 is to the Vietnam Expansion.

Different maps, different weapons and shittier sound effects are enough warrant a new title.

Read full topic

The only fun part that I actually didn’t have to force my self to play was the prison break on vorkuta. The campain is basically a revamp of WaW with some Vietnam.

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops
item.dc:creator: Deutscher_Scharfschu
item.description:
The first time I played the single player, I wasn’t a fan. but then I went back and selected kowloon city level, I think it’s called “numbers” or something like that. This time i pretended i was at the arcade, and i was playing a game like Time Crisis, and let me tell you, it was the most fun I’ve had in a call of duty game since COD1. I wish the single player was less of a story and more like the spec ops mode from MW2.

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops
item.dc:creator: russilker
item.description:
OogaBooga:

I liked MW1 and MW2’s campaigns (probably going to catch shit from it, but oh well), but when I rented Black Ops the campaign bored me. It just doesn’t let up the action at all except the loading screens. At least in MW1 you can sneak around as an SAS so it lets up on the action a little, instead of just constantly throwing action in your face like the game was on speed or something. I did like the multiplayer more than the single player and thinking if I should buy it or not.

Agreed. Not sure if its the constant action that annoyed me or not, but I just didn’t find the game enjoyable at all, even compared to MW or MW2.

Read full topic
